text:
When using SAX2 to parse a DTD the parser reports the content model incorrectly 
to to elemDecl() when the content model begins with a group, as follows:

<!ELEMENT Fruit  ((apple | pear | banana) | (orange | grapefruit | clementine) 
| (strawberry | raspberry | blueberry))>

The model is incorrectly reported as follows:

apple | pear | banana | (orange | grapefruit | clementine) | (strawberry | 
raspberry | blueberry)

Notice the first group, "apple | pear | banana" is no longer grouped with 
parens.
creator: gmessner@breezefactor.com

text:
Although this may look bad at first glance it's really not such a big deal, the 
reported model is logically equivalent to the one you have in your DTD. You may 
find desirable that the parser reports the model exactly as specified 
syntactically, but this is definitely not a Critical bug. Sorry.
creator: lehors@apache.org
sandygao@ca.ibm.com
text: It's invalid according to Arnaud's comment.
